instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message:
i have an old board i want to see what with him...
<CHIP>U7800</CHIP> was missed and i put one from donor board.
all the rest look o.k.
on charger 5v 2A-0A pulsing.
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0V diode mode 380

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message:
o.k i just notice that <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> was also missing so i put one and now:
5v 0.04a stable
PPBUS _G3H 12V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message:
There could be more missing components.
A simple resistor can stop the board to turn on.

Do you get voltage at L6960/61 and L7660?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 85931, member: 682"]
There could be more missing components.
[/QUOTE]
i was make double check now..
L6960/61 and L7660 3.3V

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message: Check if all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are present.
